titles.title: SAFE Act Confidentiality and Privilege Enhancement Act
SAFE Act Confidentiality and Privilege Enhancement Act
A bill to ensure access to certain information for financial services industry regulators, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.
Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 12/17/2013--Passed Senate without amendment. SAFE Act Confidentiality and Privilege Enhancement Act - Amends the S.A.F.E. Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 to extend to state and federal regulatory officials having financial services oversight authority (currently only those having mortgage oversight authority) access to any information provided to the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry (or any system established by the Director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau [CFPB]) without the loss of privilege or confidentiality protections provided by federal and state laws.
